bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Charles Turner Joy (February 17, 1895-June 13, 1956) was a Vice Admiral in the United States Navy, the senior United Nations delegate to the Korean Armistice Conference at Kaesong and later Panmunjom from July 1951 to May 1952, and Commander Naval Forces, Far East (COMNAVFE) from August 1949 to June 1952.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Includes diaries, notes, clippings, and photographs relating to the Panmunjom negotiations to end the Korean War.

did.unittitle: Korean Armistice Conference chronology and documents,
Lessons learned from the Korean War newspaper clippings,
"Charles Joy Turner, Vice Admiral, U.S. Navy Korea" album of clippings,
"Navy Interdiction, Korea," Vol. 2, Vice Admiral Joy, informational booklet,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 46 photos and 10 negatives concerning Vice Admiral C. Turner Joy, USN, Senior Naval Officer on the Staff of the Supreme Commander, Allied Powers, Far East, and Senior UN Delegate to the Military Armistice Negotiations in Kaesong, Korea.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda and letter concerning the United Nations Command delegation in Korea.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Navy Department, Office of Naval Intelligence correspondence from Carl F. Espe to Vice Admiral Joy providing information about members of the delegation to the Armistice Conference in Korea (General Nam Il, General Hsieh Fang, and General Lee Sang Cho).
